view

Class CalendarView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • view.CalendarView

  • public class CalendarView
extends javafx.application.Application
    This class represents the view that lets the user interact with the calendar. It works by accessing the controller and using it as the glue between the view and the model where all the data is stored. Our "Wow" Factors include the use of color coding and highlighitng the day that is currently is. Furthermore whenever you open the app it opens to the current date.
    Author:
    Peter Vukasin and Joe Corbett

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application

      • addActionHandlers

        public void addActionHandlers()
        The addActionHandlers method is used to add in all of the code used in each of our buttons and text fields. These buttons include moreCal, clearAll, previous, next, dayButton, weekButton, monthButton, addEvent, and createCal.

      • createWeekBox

        public javafx.scene.layout.HBox createWeekBox(int days,
                                              int months,
                                              int years)
        The createWeekBox method creates an Hbox that we can put directly in the center of the calander for when we need to switch between views
        Parameters:
        days - - day user wants to move to
        months - - month user wants to move to
        years - - year user wants to move to
        Returns:
        weekBox - an Hbox in the week-view format

      • createMonthBox

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox createMonthBox(int months,
                                               int years)
        The createMonthBox method does the exact same thing as the weekBox but in month format, however it is slightly longer due to necessary formatting
        Parameters:
        months - - month user wants to move to
        years - - year user wants to move to
        Returns:
        monthBox - an Hbox in the week-view format

      • createEventBox

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox createEventBox()
        Create a Dialog Box, utilized for adding an event to the Calendar.
        Returns:
        VBox - serves as the content for the Dialog box

      • updateView

        public void updateView()
        Method to update the view in live-time. It has been very useful and makes the calendar run a lot smoother

      • createTop

        public void createTop()
        Create the top of the GridPane, for the Scene

      • createBottom

        public void createBottom()
        Create the bottom of the GridPane, for the Scene

      • dayView

        public javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane dayView(java.lang.Integer day,
                                               java.lang.Integer month,
                                               java.lang.Integer year)
        Create a singular day in the Calendar, using a ScrollPane to wrap around a VBox(). Each specific Event is given an EventHandler to help the user see that Event, if clicked on.
        Parameters:
        day - - an Integer representing day
        month - - an Integer representing month
        year - - an Integer representing year
        Returns:
        dayScroller - aka the scrolling pane for the day view

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method is actually quite important for the serialization process. It first checks to see if the calendar is empty and if it is, a new fresh one is created. If it is not however it used the old data that was stored
        Parameters:
        args - - args from main app none in this case
